meanings.definition: The supposed faculty of perceiving things or events in the future or beyond normal sensory contact.
meanings.sent1: Her clairvoyance allowed her to foresee the upcoming storm.
meanings.sent2: Many people believe in the power of clairvoyance to predict future events.
meanings.sent3: During the magic show, the magician joked about having clairvoyance to read minds.
meanings.sent4: His clairvoyance was like a crystal ball, revealing secrets hidden from others.
meanings.sent5: The clairvoyance of the fortune teller was so accurate, it seemed like magic.

meanings.definition: A person who claims to have a supernatural ability to perceive events in the future or beyond normal sensory contact.
meanings.sent1: The clairvoyance at the fair claimed to see visions of the future.
meanings.sent2: She was known in the town as the local clairvoyance, offering readings to curious customers.
meanings.sent3: The clairvoyance's predictions were so outlandish that they made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His reputation as a clairvoyance spread like wildfire, with people seeking his insights.
meanings.sent5: The old woman's clairvoyance was a source of wonder and mystery to the villagers.
